title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A classic novel set in the Jazz Age, exploring themes of wealth, love, and the American Dream.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about racial injustice and moral growth in the Deep South.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel about totalitarianism and surveillance.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel about manners, marriage, and societal expectations.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A story about teenage rebellion and self-discovery.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy adventure about a hobbit’s journey to reclaim a lost treasure.

title: Moby Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: A tale of obsession and revenge between a sailor and a great white whale.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: An epic novel about Russian society during the Napoleonic Wars.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A psychological exploration of guilt and redemption.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A philosophical tale about following your dreams.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic fantasy about the battle between good and evil.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: The magical beginning of Harry Potter’s journey.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
description: A story of friendship, betrayal, and redemption.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
description: A tale of love and loss during World War II.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian novel about a technologically advanced society.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
description: A post-apocalyptic journey of survival and hope.

title: The Shining
author: Stephen King
description: A chilling tale of isolation and madness.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: The original vampire novel that started it all.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A tale of science, ambition, and unintended consequences.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A story about vanity, morality, and the cost of eternal youth.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
description: A dystopian novel about survival and rebellion in a totalitarian society.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: A science fiction epic about politics, religion, and ecology on a desert planet.

title: The Fault in Our Stars
author: John Green
description: A touching story about love and loss between two teenagers with cancer.

title: The Chronicles of Narnia
author: C.S. Lewis
description: A fantasy series about children discovering a magical world through a wardrobe.

title: The Maze Runner
author: James Dashner
description: A dystopian novel about teenagers trapped in a deadly maze.

title: Percy Jackson & The Olympians
author: Rick Riordan
description: A modern fantasy series about a boy discovering he is a demigod.

title: The Giver
author: Lois Lowry
description: A dystopian novel about a boy discovering the truth about his seemingly perfect society.

title: The Outsiders
author: S.E. Hinton
description: A coming-of-age story about friendship and class struggles.

title: The Secret Garden
author: Frances Hodgson Burnett
description: A story about a young girl discovering a hidden garden and healing through nature.

title: Anne of Green Gables
author: L.M. Montgomery
description: A heartwarming tale about an imaginative orphan finding a home.
